Funny you sho=
uld say that, because that's exactly how TestNG supports
dependent tests.

=
You can specify that a group B of test methods "depends on" a group A of
te=
st methods.  In this case, TestNG guarantees that

- All methods in group A=
 will be run before any method in group B is
invoked.
- All methods in grou=
p A will have succeeded.  If at least one of them
failed, then all test met=
hods in group B will be marked as "SKIPPED" (not
run), which makes it much =
easier for you to figure out which test exactly
broke the chain ("cascade e=
ffect").

Here is an excerpt of my slides on this subject:
